At Mon, 14 Jun 2010 17:45:58 +0100,
Andrea Fiore wrote:
>
> Hi there,
> I am moving my first steps with Heritrix and, excited by the new REST
> API, I've started playing around with the 3.1.1 snapshot. I have noticed
> that, whereas version 1 and 2  save the crawl results into .ARC files,
> this new version of Heritrix stores them in the new .WARC format.
>
> Although I've been searching on both Google and on this list, I am still
> not sure on how the stored WARC archive might be extracted and accessed.
> Is there any alternative to using the open source Wayback
> (http://archive-access.sourceforge.net/projects/wayback/)? I am not very
> familiar with server side Java (and with java in general) and ideally I
> would like to dispose of a more general purpose command line archive
> extraction tool, so I could build my own viewer on the top of it.

Hi Andrea -

Open source wayback supports WARC files, so you should be able to use
Wayback with WARC files.

For lower level support of WARC files, see the WARC-tools project:

  http://code.google.com/p/warc-tools/

best,
Erik

--Multipart_Mon_Jun_14_15:34:07_2010-1
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=US-ASCII
